intro: Gossypium pulchellum, commonly known as the velvetleaf cotton or silky cotton, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous small, fluffy seeds. Gossypium pulchellum is primarily grown for its ornamental value rather than for fiber production.
